page.title: 03A Large Estate
page.content: Some of the land at the eastern edge of the survey area belongs to the {Sennowe Park Estate,}formerly owned by Sir Thomas Cook, and now farmed by his son - also Thomas. Crops grown are similar to those at{Ashworth's farm (See page 2), plus sugar beet. Mr. Cook has dairy cattle too (Friesians), and a small herd of beef cattle (Hereford), and 300 to 400 sheep, producing about 500 lambs a year. The sheep are dipped to prevent sheep scab each July and September, and sheared in May or June. The fleeces are sold to the Wool Board. The area has much woodland, made up of mixed species (deciduous and conifer) at different ages, this form of continuous rotation being most productive.
